post.title: How to set an alarm on a certain time or date-time with bash sleep command from terminal
post.body:
'sleep' command is very useful when setting a timer before running any command just like:

```
sleep 5s && echo "hello world";
```

But there's no dedicated command for setting an alarm on a certain date-time such as:

```
alarm 'tomorrow 7:24AM' && "wake up!";
```

Now I'm going to show you how to implement this with the embedded commands like 'sleep' and 'date'. A good thing with 'date' command is it has its own timestamp parsing function in it. That is, we can describe date-time format in a various ways such as 'today 21:30', '+1day 13:10' (= Mon 8 Apr 13:10:00 KST 2019 in case of Korea), or '2019-04-09 23:01:03':

```
sleep $(( $( date -d '13:0' +%s ) - $(date -d now +%s) )) && echo "It's 13:00:00!";
```

`+%s` means it shows the output in a format of the seconds elapsed since 1970 Jan 1 till 2019 April 7 13:00:00 or till now. `$(( a - b ))` shows the mathematical operation of 'a -b' so that sleep for the time difference in seconds between the target time and the current time, and then print "It's 13:00:00!".

Make it into a function:

```
sleep-alarm() { sleep $(( $( date -d "$1" +%s ) - $(date -d now +%s) )); }

sleep-alarm 'today 7PM' && echo 'Kick the door and surprise Tom.';
```

They all have the dirt on each other. (4) Satanic ritual abuse is used to create controllable split personalities, like in the Manchurian Candidate. (5) They get posessed By evil entities who controls them and feeds of their energies and make them do even more evil things (6) Satan needs his Loosh._ **“hotdog” = boy** **“pizza” = girl** **“cheese” = little girl** **“pasta” = little boy** **“ice cream” = male prostitute** **“walnut” = person of colour** **“map” = semen** **“sauce” = orgy** Examples: ![CwX8GckXUAAHmRU.jpg (0x0)](data/img/post_32_CwX8GckXUAAHmRU.jpg) ![MAIL3-240x300.png (0x0)](data/img/post_32_MAIL3-240x300.png) ![MAIL2-300x159.png (0x0)](data/img/post_32_MAIL2-300x159.png)
[https://wikileaks.org/podesta-emails/emailid/19018](https://wikileaks.org/podesta-emails/emailid/19018)
_I consider ice cream, its purchase, and its consumption a rather serious business. We can’t just willy-nilly toss it out and about in casual references, especially linked with the word “free”._ [https://wikileaks.org/podesta-emails/emailid/30613](https://wikileaks.org/podesta-emails/emailid/30613) _Lo and behold, instead of pasta and wonderful sauces, it was a lovely, tempting assortment of cheeses, Yummy. I am awaiting the return of my children and grandchildren from their holiday travels so that we can demolish them._ [https://wikileaks.org/podesta-emails/emailid/32795](https://wikileaks.org/podesta-emails/emailid/32795) _Hi John, The realtor found a handkerchief (I think it has a map that seems pizza-related. Is it yours? They can send it if you want. I know you’re busy, so feel free not to respond if it’s not yours or you don’t want it_. [https://wikileaks.org/podesta-emails/emailid/44232](https://wikileaks.org/podesta-emails/emailid/44232) _Thx for coming out. Always happy to babysit._
For those of you who would like a little more information on who John Podesta is and how powerful he is (“one of the most powerful men on Wall Street/Washington D.C.”), I highly recommend this documentary that just came out titled ‘The Empire Files: Abby Martin Exposes John Podesta’: I’d also like to add that his brother, Tony Podesta, was asked to come to a Spirit Cooking session with artist and Luciferian, Marina Abrimovic.
![marina-abramovic.png (0x0)](data/img/post_32_marina-abramovic.png) [Source](http://shikixd.tumblr.com/post/113499195097/moojaa-dehumanization-occult-fashion-marina)
**[https://wikileaks.org/podesta-emails/emailid/15893](https://wikileaks.org/podesta-emails/emailid/15893):** _Dear Tony [Podesta], I am so looking forward to the Spirit Cooking dinner at my place. Do you think you will be able to let me know if your brother [John Podesta] is joining?_ _All my love,_ _Marina_ Now let’s get on to some of the e-mails: Updated 11/27/2016 @ 1254 **[https://wikileaks.com/podesta-emails/emailid/22033](https://wikileaks.com/podesta-emails/emailid/22033):** _If you will be around for dinner or **pizza** on Sunday would love to see you and hear about addis and California._ _Let me know_ _Tony Podesta_ **[https://wikileaks.com/podesta-emails/emailid/56492](https://wikileaks.com/podesta-emails/emailid/56492):** **_Still in torture chamber_** _Another question._ _Do you two wanna have feb 14 valentines day dinner_ _Sent from my iPad_ Updated 11/8/2016 @ 1746: **[https://wikileaks.com/dnc-emails/emailid/7036](https://wikileaks.com/dnc-emails/emailid/7036):** _Been meaning to thank you for being with me during my first **“lollipop” experience**. Appreciated your support and your steady presence. My only regret is that **I didn’t take my lollipop with me ![1f642_.gif (0x0)](data/img/post_32_1f642_.gif)**_ _Leah, has anyone notified you that you have a **lollipop** to be in the spin room at tonight’s debate? Are you up for it? I’d be with you so can tackle things not specific to the convention with you._ Updated: 11/7 @ 1749: **[https://wikileaks.com/podesta-emails/emailid/53745](https://wikileaks.com/podesta-emails/emailid/53745):** _Hillary **pizza** party April 10_ _Does Hillary want to do 2 events that day? Ours as a higher dollar event?_ _Invite please **Pizza** for Hillsry_ _Hosting **pizza** party at Belmont for HFA on April 10\. Maya Harris is joining, but need you. Can you come? Thanks much,_ _Tony_ **[https://wikileaks.com/podesta-emails/emailid/48531](https://wikileaks.com/podesta-emails/emailid/48531):** _Great show! Great speech. Raised over 40 grand. My only regret is I did not make you a nice **pizza**._ _When can I?_ **[https://wikileaks.org/podesta-emails/emailid/19018](https://wikileaks.org/podesta-emails/emailid/19018):** _I consider **ice cream**, its purchase, and its consumption a rather serious business. We can’t just willy-nilly toss it out and about in casual references, especially linked with the word “free”._ **[https://wikileaks.org/podesta-emails/emailid/32795](https://wikileaks.org/podesta-emails/emailid/32795):** _Hi John, The realtor found a **handkerchief** (I think it has a **map** that seems **pizza**-related. Is it yours? They can send it if you want. I know you’re busy, so feel free not to respond if it’s not yours or you don’t want it_. **[https://wikileaks.org/podesta-emails/emailid/44232](https://wikileaks.org/podesta-emails/emailid/44232):** _Thx for coming out. **Always happy to babysit**._ **[https://wikileaks.org/podesta-emails/emailid/50332](https://wikileaks.org/podesta-emails/emailid/50332):** _Mary and John I think you should give notice when changing strategies which have been long in place. I immediately realized something was different by the shape of the box and I contemplated who would be sending me something in the square shaped box. Lo and behold, instead of **pasta** and wonderful **sauces**, it was a lovely, tempting assortment of **cheeses**, Yummy. I am awaiting the return of my children and grandchildren from their holiday travels so that **we can demolish them**. Thank you so much. I hope you and your gang are well. I miss you both Best wishes fro a merry Christmas and Happy New Year._ _Herb_ _Ps. Do you think I’ll do better playing **dominos** on **cheese** than on **pasta**?_ **[https://wikileaks.com/podesta-emails/emailid/28891](https://wikileaks.com/podesta-emails/emailid/28891):** _**Walnut** growing northern CA surely knows and celebrates **walnut** **pasta sauce**? Actually what surprises me is that we haven’t already served it to you._ _It’s an amazing Ligurian dish made with crushed **walnuts** made into a paste. So stop being so California._ _Hey John, We know you’re a true master of cuisine and we have appreciated that for years … But **walnut sauce** for the **pasta**? Mary, plz tell us the straight story, was the**sauce** actually very tasty?_ _Love to all the Podestas from the Steyers!_ _Cheers, Jim_ **[https://wikileaks.org/podesta-emails/emailid/53381](https://wikileaks.org/podesta-emails/emailid/53381):** _I should go through? I look forward to working with you (and maybe getting some of that **pasta and walnut sauce** dish!!)_ _All best, Eleanor_ **[https://wikileaks.org/podesta-emails/emailid/30231](https://wikileaks.org/podesta-emails/emailid/30231):** _The next three months are going to be rougher internally than in Beijing. Between 7th and 1600, no fun. Hope you’re doing ok. I’m dreaming about your **hotdog** stand in Hawaii…_ **[https://wikileaks.com/dnc-emails/emailid/21627](https://wikileaks.com/dnc-emails/emailid/21627):** _We promised her a package, Rachel cleared that. I think we created one – like **Walnut**or something. Does this ring a bell?_ _Do you remember what we decided to do with this? Her name was Catherine George and she maxed out in March. I think I stayed out of the discussion because it was Tri-State related, but now I’m having trouble remembering where it ended up._ _Yes. We made a $33,400 level up for this. I will send you the exact package when I find it._ **[https://wikileaks.com/clinton-emails/emailid/16662](https://wikileaks.com/clinton-emails/emailid/16662):** _QUESTION: (Laughter.) The **pizza** party —_ _SECRETARY CLINTON: Oh, right._ _QUESTION: At the **pizza** party —_ _SECRETARY CLINTON: Right, right._ _QUESTION: — she said to you she likes your hair long, and she said it suits where you are in your life right now. Do you remember her saying this to you?_ _SECRETARY CLINTON: Honestly, I don’t, but —_ _QUESTION: Okay. I don’t even bring this up._ **[https://wikileaks.com/dnc-emails/emailid/14349](https://wikileaks.com/dnc-emails/emailid/14349)** (this e-mail appeared to be spam about a gift card to Macy’s): _Absolutely wonderful food! Went on **Pasta** Night, had the special homemade ravioli in pink sauce with crab. The ravioli were exceptional–al dente fresh…. Such a nice place. The service is very good and our waitress really took care of us. ..I had dinner with some colleagues; they had a black angus beef, I… Such amazing **pizza**! Always have to have some when in the area! Every Memorial Weekend, it’s tradition my family goes to Aj’s before the madness of our Memorial party the following day. ..We love it! The food is… I’m a big hibachi person. I’ve been coming here for hibachi since I was a teenager. Unfortunately, it’s just been getting less and less about the show and… Excellent **pizza**. My first time trying this **pizza**…They were quite accommodating us on a Sunday. ..We needed 7 pies for a family gathering, and they were so… Great atmosphere most of the dishes are very good_ **[https://wikileaks.org/podesta-emails/emailid/52225](https://wikileaks.org/podesta-emails/emailid/52225):** _John and Mary I just received the holiday package of **pasta** and **sauce**. If only I could make it turn out as special as you guys do. Many thanks._ _Much love_ _Herb_ **[https://wikileaks.org/podesta-emails/emailid/55744](https://wikileaks.org/podesta-emails/emailid/55744):** _So that’s our ice encased wiper and taste of the traffic we are in. Suffice to say we will not make it tonight, I am sad to say. Have to settle for the **pasta** john gave us at Christmas. Really sorry to miss._ **[https://wikileaks.org/podesta-emails/emailid/34860](https://wikileaks.org/podesta-emails/emailid/34860):** _You were having a lot more fun than I was. Very good meeting with Darren which I will report on._ _Susan whipped Sherry and me at **Dominos**. Using the Podesta method, she made up the rules as we played._ **[https://wikileaks.org/podesta-emails/emailid/53525](https://wikileaks.org/podesta-emails/emailid/53525):** _Everything has been fine, except that we missed you and Mary. We went on another boat ride with Chuck and Nancy Parrish. Bob Solow joined us. Lots of fun. He had a great line on the Greek situation which I will forward to you separately. Also had dinner with Skip, his daughter and her fiancée. He thinks you’re great. Today-**dominos**. We won’t be calling you for the rules._ **[https://wikileaks.com/dnc-emails/emailid/24905](https://wikileaks.com/dnc-emails/emailid/24905):** _“A PIE IN THEIR FACE: GOP big tells **kid-sex** pics he’s too busy to hear their stories of abuse because he was late to THIS important **pizza** party”_ **[https://wikileaks.com/dnc-emails/emailid/2476](https://wikileaks.com/dnc-emails/emailid/2476):** _Thanks Jackie! I have also heard good things about the **pizza**!_ _Any chance we will hear back from them over the weekend? Or will it likely be Monday._ _Most importantly, as a former Cambridge resident I can vouch that this place has really good **pizza**, solid event choice._ **[https://wikileaks.org/gifiles/docs/12/1223066_re-get-ready-for-chicago-hot-dog-friday-.html](https://wikileaks.org/gifiles/docs/12/1223066_re-get-ready-for-chicago-hot-dog-friday-.html):** _I think Obama spent about $65,000 of the tax-payers money flying in_ _**pizza/dogs** from Chicago for a private party at the White House not long_ _ago, assume we are using the same channels?_ They appear to use **pizza** a lot which, if the code word is correct, means girl.
**[Wikileaks Source](https://wikileaks.com/dnc-emails/emailid/31818)**
And another e-mail that contained an attached picture of two asian women eating pizza with a little girl with John Podesta saying: _It doesn’t get any better than this_
![pizza-300x225.jpg (0x0)](data/img/post_32_pizza-300x225.jpg) [Source](https://wikileaks.org/podesta-emails/emailid/10037)
The two women in the photo are [Euna Lee](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Euna_Lee "Euna Lee") and [Laura Ling](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Laura_Ling "Laura Ling") who were arrested in North Korea for child trafficking. **[Here](https://www.reddit.com/r/The_Donald/comments/5axyn9/yesterday_i_broke_a_story_about_the_clintons/)** is the Reddit thread with more information on this. **[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2009_imprisonment_of_American_journalists_by_North_Korea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2009_imprisonment_of_American_journalists_by_North_Korea)** There is one particular e-mail about the sale of some ‘beanie babies’, which at first seems benign enough, until you read further: **[https://wikileaks.org/podesta-emails/emailid/26263](https://wikileaks.org/podesta-emails/emailid/26263):** _Georgetown Law Faculty and Staff, My parents are visiting this weekend, and I need to sell my enormous collection of beanie babies! I’ve approximately 480 little creatures of joy, and I’m selling each one for $20.00\. You must buy all 480, though. It is a collection (not an auction)… They are very respectful and amicable with one another, and they are (for the most part) cat and dog friendly. Some are sassier than others, naturally. Please let me know! My parents can’t find out._ _Peter Mattingly_ Could some of these children have been used as ‘entertainment’ at a pool party described in the following e-mail? **[https://wikileaks.org/podesta-emails/emailid/46736](https://wikileaks.org/podesta-emails/emailid/46736):** _With enormous gratitude to Advance Man Extraordinaire Haber, I am popping up again to share our excitement about the Reprise of Our Gang’s visit to the farm in Lovettsville. And I thought I’d share a couple more notes: We plan to heat the pool, so a swim is a possibility. **Bonnie will be Uber Service to transport Ruby, Emerson, and Maeve Luzzatto (11, 9, and almost 7) so you’ll have some further entertainment, and they will be in that pool for sure.** And with the forecast showing prospects of some sun, and a cooler temp of lower 60s, I suggest you bring sweaters of whatever attire will enable us to use our outdoor table with a pergola overhead so we dine al fresco (and ideally not al-CHILLo)._ With all the informations above and the other leaked emails you can read on wikileaks it’s safe to say there’s definitly something going on with these people, something very dark and evil is controlling our governments and it needs to be known. The people need to know what these people who ” governs” us are really up to. The truth is coming out and it’s just the beginning. A new era for humanity is coming, an era where all these hidden things will all come to light and humanity will reclaim it’s liberty, that era is not so far away, the only thing that will bring this evil draconian empire is US.

### [8mm (film)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/8mm_(film)) 1999 film by Joel Schumacher
8mm is a 1999 American-German crime mystery film directed by Joel Schumacher and written by Andrew Kevin Walker. The film stars Nicolas Cage as a private investigator who delves into the world of snuff films. Joaquin Phoenix, James Gandolfini, Peter Stormare, and Anthony Heald appear in supporting roles. post.title: ZeroBlog derivatives : How to increase the number of the latest comments on the left pane
post.body:
Edit `js/all.js`.

Replace `ORDER BY date_added DESC LIMIT 3` with `ORDER BY date_added DESC LIMIT 30`.

Save and sign/publish and ctrl-F5\. done.

post.title: ZeroBlog derivatives(Binchan's) : How to remove 'Send Message' floating menu
post.body:
Edit `1Gtub..../index.html`.

Find `<script type="text/javascript" src="zeromessage/all.js"> </script>` and remove it or comment out it by replacing with `<!-- <script type="text/javascript" src="zeromessage/all.js"> </script> -->`.

Save and sign/publish your blog and Ctrl-F5.

post.title: ZeroBlog derivatives : How to remove the restriction on image size for uploading
post.body:
This would also work for ZeroMe, I guess.

Plz refer to the previous discussion on image size restriction problem on ZeroMe: http://127.0.0.1:43110/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/1SunAWK2VUT9GQK32MpwRfFPVgcBSJN9a/16dEowtNbV89NxPcDrAKkmnuXtiJVoVcDm/1533451651

How to free the image size limit of ZeroBlog and its derivatives?

Open `all.js` in js/folder of your blog directory under zeronet installed folder.

Find `if (e.data.file.size > this.image_size_limit) {` and replace it with `if (false) {`.

Save and sign&publish the blog. Ctrl-F5\. Try to upload the image of which size is larger than `this.image_size_limit = 200 * 1024;`.

Sample post: [Discover of the World first metal movable type in Korea (75 years earlier than Gutenberg's)](../1Gtubs5zzkhkVAxiEyZuYTJMWSpJ1qY22s/?Post:24)

post.title: How to put video clips in your ZeroBlog derivatives.
post.body:
I reverse engineered @nofish's blog post here: [http://127.0.0.1:43110/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post:126:New+version:+0.6.2](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post:126:New+version:+0.6.2)

And found out that his post has the following html codes:

`<video width=\"700\" height=\"400\" controls=\"\" preload=\"none\" muted=\"\" poster=\"data/video/local_peer_discovery.jpg\"><source data-cke-saved-src=\"data/video/local_peer_discovery.mp4\" src=\"data/video/local_peer_discovery.mp4\" type=\"video/mp4\"></video>`

And I just simplified his codes into the following codes:

`<video controls=""><source src="data/img/how missile turns its direction 90 degrees on the fly.mp4"></video>`

In case of this blog, in the body edit box you have to click `</>` button on the top right corner to enter the markdown mode. And then insert the above codes in the middle of the body text.

Don't forget that u must have already uploaded .mp4 file in `zeronet/data/1Gtu..../data/img/how missile turns its direction 90 degrees on the fly.mp4` to make the above src path work.

<video controls=""><source src="data/img/how missile turns its direction 90 degrees on the fly.mp4"></video>

post.title: Lunar New Year in Asia and the symbolic meaning of the year 2019
post.body:
February 5, 2019 is Jan 1 of lunar calendar, and is called New Year, called 설(Surl) in Korea, or 春節(chūnjié) in China.
.
On Jan 1 of lunar calendar the title of each year changes. There're 60 titles of the years beginning with the year 갑자(Gabja; 甲子) and ending with the year 개혜(Gaehae; 癸亥). After the year Gaehae, it's the year Gabja again. The front letter of a pair of letters which makes up each title is repeated in order of 10 [천간cheongan; 天干; Heavenly Stems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heavenly_Stems), and the tail letter is repeated in order of 12 [지지Jiji; 地支; Earthly Branches](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Earthly_Branches). The both letters make up total 60 titles ( = 10 x 12 ). It's a kind of sexagenary numbering system. Each of 10 heavenly stems and 12 earthly branches has its own meaning so that each of 60 titles comes to have a unique meaning as well.
.
For example it's 기해(Giihae; 己亥) this year. Gii means Yellow and Hae means Pig. People used to call it Golden Pig's year. In Asia, pig as a symbol has a meaning of richness or prosperity, and yellow reminds of gold. So it is believed that it's very lucky year.
.
How do they make it into their luck? They used to give a special meaning if a baby is born in the year Giihae. And his Asian star sign becomes Pig. But nowadays most people don't give it much meaning anyway. Most times it is used as only marketing purposes, it's like, to induce people to spend some extra money.
.
But it's still meaningful to those who're preparing university entrance exam or civil service exams because in history many historical events were named after the year title of the year it happened. And in my case I even memorized the formula to convert Gregorian calendar year into sexagenary title and vise versa.
.
In regard with the tail letter as the animal sign, Koreans call this a birth star sign 띠(Tii; year of animal) though it's actually not related to horoscope or constellation of the West, but this system was originally created based on Jupiter's 12 year routine anyway. If one was born in 2019, his animal sign is Pig.
.
When you meet someone in Korea and if u feel like asking his/her age, u can ask him/her his/her Tii rather than asking him/her his/her birth year or age directly since it's a little rude. And then u can easily find out how old he/she is if the age gap between u and him/her is less than 24 years. This is the usual way to find out someone's age because it has a little bit of funny thing to talk about animal signs of each other. ( born in 2019 pig, 2020 mouse, 2021 cow, tiger, rabbit, dragon, snake, horse, sheep, monkey, chicken, dog, pig(again). Animal signs were introduced from 12 gods of Buddhism. )
.
These 12 animal signs or earthly branches have been also used as unit of hours of a day in ancient times by saying each branch points a pair of hours so that total 12 make up 24 hours a day since thousands of years ago. That is, there was also duodecimal numbering system in Asia.
.
Anyway, if u're going to have time with ur family or friends during Surl holidays, this post will give u a small tip to make a talk with others.
.
Happy lunar new year! (^_~)_/

post.title: 'zero://' idea would never be standardized or used commonly in any future day.
post.body:
By [leftside](../1Gtubs5zzkhkVAxiEyZuYTJMWSpJ1qY22s/) sos4sos@riseup.net 2019-02-12 14:04:35+0900

**Discussion continued from** [SUGGESTION: http:_127.0.0.1:43110_zeronet.io_1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT - ZeroTalk](../Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1549935069_16dEowtNbV89NxPcDrAKkmnuXtiJVoVcDm)

'zero://' idea would never be standardized or used commonly in any future day.

We can't escape from a kind of the common browser standard unless someone starts firefox-like project for zeronet.
No one can force people to install a special extension or something to make use of zeronet.

Installing ZeroBundle itself is already burden to them. lol.

People easily install bitTorrent client since they expect some sweet candy inside it from the beginning.
But it's hardly possible to expect something sweet in Zeronet from the view point of the normal people. :)

post.title: SUGGESTION: http://127.0.0.1:43110/zeronet.io/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT
post.body:
**Further discussion** : [http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1549935069_16dEowtNbV89NxPcDrAKkmnuXtiJVoVcDm](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1549935069_16dEowtNbV89NxPcDrAKkmnuXtiJVoVcDm)

It's a regret that @nofish hasn't put the landmark in ZeroNet URL format.
So I suggest @nofish and other zeronet Jedi(s) to make the upgraded zeronet URL system.

Put "zeronet.io" in every URL of zeronet sites:

`http://127.0.0.1:43110/zeronet.io/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT`
becomes the same as `http://127.0.0.1:43110/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT`.

`zeronet.io` is not a **MUST** part of the URL but optional.
That is, every other existing URLs will still work fine even after applying this upgrade, but it will still work even with `zeronet.io` is attached.

If possible, it'd be better if zeronet itself automatically converted every exiting URL into `...43110/zeronet.io/...` just to be shown in the browser not to be converted in database level so that even though any time any user copies URLs of any moment in zeronet they would get `...43110/zeronet.io...` URLs for reference.

If needed, we can put `0net.io` or something as cadidates as well. You can put `visit_zeronet.io_to_download_zeronet_server_client` as well! lol.

# Or you can just open the first level path to anything whatever they type!

Like, "[http://127.0.0.1:43110/**This_is_how_to_kill_the_mocking_bird**/16J4mEgR5aqerfzGy2WctNV3onPQUgF2E5/upload/real%20size%20of%20countries%20map%206wncgOBGIC8.jpg](/16J4mEgR5aqerfzGy2WctNV3onPQUgF2E5/upload/real%20size%20of%20countries%20map%206wncgOBGIC8.jpg)". lol.

**What's the benefit?**

By adding this feature in zeronet URL format, even though u put zeronet URL in the clearnet, people can still find a hint where to go with zeronet URL. At the moment, if u put zeronet URL anywhere in the world, most people will think it's just a crab and some will regard it just a stupid newbie's mistake putting his home local PC's server URL in the public.

But if u put `zeronet.io`, they will definitely notice it and will try to figure out what `zeronet.io` is. (Of course, if it's zeronet`.net` it would attract people's interest more easily anyway. -- by [leftside](../Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Profile/1SunAWK2VUT9GQK32MpwRfFPVgcBSJN9a/16dEowtNbV89NxPcDrAKkmnuXtiJVoVcDm/leftside@zeroid.bit) sos4sos@riseup.net // 2019-02-12 10:27:35+0900

PS: Furthermore we also need to make the design [http://zeronet.io](http://zeronet.io) more intuitive.

post.title: Bash: String finding and manipulating with function or shell commands on the fly with non-sed method (How to make it faster)
post.body:
`sed` is a very convenient tool to replace the matching strings in the text in various ways. But it is not possible to apply a function or a set of commands to manipulate the replacing process for the searched pattern. For example you can replace every number in the text with 'USD [number]' from '[number]' such as '34.50' to 'USD 34.50' by simply executing `cat text.txt | sed 's/[0-9\.]*/USD &/g'`. But In case you may want to change every random number found in the text to be replaced with the number multiplied by 2 of each such as 34.50 to 69.00, it doesn't work with `cat text.txt | sed "s/[0-9\.]*/$(echo "&*2"|bc)/g"` because the sub-shell `$(echo ...)` runs before `sed` completes its syntax. There're many workarounds for this purpose, but I'll introduce the most optimum way I found.

First of all, let's see the sample commands below:

`./ZeroNet.sh dbQuery 1MeFqFfFFGQfa1J3gJyYYUvb5Lksczq7nH "SELECT * FROM follow WHERE auth_address IS '16dEowtNbV89NxPcDrAKkmnuXtiJVoVcDm'" | xargs -d '\n' -i bash -c 'echo '\'{}\'' | grep -q date_added && (echo '\'{}\'' | egrep -o "[0-9]*" | while read a; do echo \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ "\"date_added\": \"$(date -d @$a +%Y-%m-%d\ %H:%M:%S)\","; done ) || echo '\'{}\'`

**EXPLAIN**

./ZeroNet.sh dbQuery 1MeFqFfFFGQfa1J3gJyYYUvb5Lksczq7nH "SELECT * FROM follow WHERE auth_address IS '16dEowtNbV89NxPcDrAKkmnuXtiJVoVcDm'"

: lists all the followers of user '16dEowtNbV89NxPcDrAKkmnuXtiJVoVcDm'.

: sample result is as follows:

```
{
    "follow_id": 28,
    "hub": "1SunAWK2VUT9GQK32MpwRfFPVgcBSJN9a",
    "auth_address": "16dEowtNbV89NxPcDrAKkmnuXtiJVoVcDm",
    "json_id": 28779,
    "date_added": 1522618500,
    "user_name": "leftside"
},
```

: But the property "date_added" is not human readable. It's Epoch time format so that we need to convert this value into normal YYYY-mm-dd HH:MM:SS format whenever this property matches the regex pattern. Will discuss later.

| xargs -d '\n' -i bash -c '[shell commands]'

: Executes bash [shell commands] for every string from the result of the previous command. -d option defines the delimiter which tells xargs how to separate strings received from the previous command. -d '\n' means the conventional end of line CR-LF character will be a separator or a delimiter for each string. -i option tells xargs the substitution sign of the string is by default '{}'. Whenever u put '{}' in the middle of the [shell commands] it automatically interprets it into the full string which was sorted by the delimiter. For example, `echo "Simson has four fingers" | xargs -i echo "This is the string received from the previous command : {}";` will print:

; This is the string received from the previous command : Simson has four fingers

echo '{}' | grep -q date_added

: Tests {} string with grep -q [pattern]; command. -q means DO NOT PRINT THE MATCHING STRING but SEND SUCCESS OR FAILURE expression as a result of grep command. 'date_added' means the pattern what we're searching for in the string.

&& [command#1] || [command#2]

: && means that if the result of the previous command is SUCCESS precede [command#1], but if FAILed precede [command#2] after || sign. So, if the grep command found 'date_added' in the string it will execute [command#1] but if there's other than 'date_added' it will execute [command#2].

[command#1] : && (echo '{}' | egrep -o "[0-9]*" | while read a; do echo \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ "\"date_added\": \"$(date -d @$a +%Y-%m-%d\ %H:%M:%S)\","; done )

: If SUCCESS, it will extract the value for the property 'date_added' and send it to `while read a; do ... done` command to manipulate it into normal date format. egrep means it will grep but the target pattern will be expressed in regex format such as `[0-9]*` which means 'any characters which are numbers in series'. In this case it will be 1522618500 from the string '"date_added": 1522618500,'. -o means print only the matched characters since without -o option it will print the entire string '"date_added": 1522618500,' just by coloring 1522618500 with red to indicates which parts are matching among the full string.

while read a; do echo \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ "\"date_added\": \"$(date -d @$a +%Y-%m-%d\ %H:%M:%S)\","; done

: Put the matched string '1522618500' in the previous command into the variable $a. And reconstruct the full string with the converted date format and print it.

[command#2] : || echo '\'{}\'

: If FAILED in searching 'date_added' which means the received line from dbQuery is just a normal string which doesn't have 'date_added' pattern in it. Then just print it out without any manipulation.

```
{
    "follow_id": 28,
    "hub": "1SunAWK2VUT9GQK32MpwRfFPVgcBSJN9a",
    "auth_address": "16dEowtNbV89NxPcDrAKkmnuXtiJVoVcDm",
    "json_id": 28779,
    "date_added": "2018-04-02 06:35:00",
    "user_name": "leftside"
},
```

As u see, the date format of 'date_added' is now human readable.

**PROBLEM OF EXECUTION TIME**

But in spite of somewhat short addition of the commands such as 'egrep -o .... date -d@ ...' the processing speed became too slow compared to the set of the commands without xargs and its trailing commands. Without xargs and etc, it counts 0.789s, but with the above full commands it counts 15.818s!

**BENEFIT OF SH OVER BASH**

The culprit was `bash`. If I replace it with `sh` it counts only 3.799s! Not bad.

**BENEFIT OF WHILE OVER XARGS**

What'bout using `| while read b; do ... done` without `bash` or `sh` instead of `| xargs` combination? It's even faster! 2.321s! But `| while` doesn't have a method to make a delimiter to include the head spaces of the string. For example the result becomes as follows:

```
{
"follow_id": 2,
"hub": "1SunAWK2VUT9GQK32MpwRfFPVgcBSJN9a",
"auth_address": "16dEowtNbV89NxPcDrAKkmnuXtiJVoVcDm",
"json_id": 22119,
        "date_added": "2018-03-04 18:53:44",
"user_name": "Leftside"
},
```

As you see it destroyed the indentation in front of each properties except what I forced to print `\ \ \ \ ...` while reconstructing the date_added line.

**WHILE-READ ALSO HAS DELIMITER**

But it's my lack of knowledge. It has a delimiter feature. Use `| while IFS='\n' read b; do ... done`. It behaves exactly the same as `| xargs -d '\n'`. Although xargs doesn't let multiple commands to executed inside it without the help of `bash -c` or `sh -c` with the followed annoying single quotes, 'while read' allows normal commands without any limit and without the additional CPU consuming commands such as bash -c or sh -c.

**FINAL VERSION**

`time ./ZeroNet.sh dbQuery 1MeFqFfFFGQfa1J3gJyYYUvb5Lksczq7nH "SELECT * FROM follow WHERE auth_address IS '16dEowtNbV89NxPcDrAKkmnuXtiJVoVcDm'" | while IFS='\n' read b; do echo "$b" | grep -q date_added && (echo "$b" | egrep -o "[0-9]*" | while read a; do echo \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ "\"date_added\": \"$(date -d @$a +%Y-%m-%d\ %H:%M:%S)\","; done ) || echo "$b"; done;`

; 2.321s

-- by leftside , sos4sos@riseup.net 2019-02-11 17:18:18+0900

Further reading: [bash command trick: Accepting piped stdout from the previous command without xargs](../1Gtubs5zzkhkVAxiEyZuYTJMWSpJ1qY22s/?Post:6)

post.title: Recovering Boot loader from the corrupted SD card on Orange Pi (Raspberry Pi)
post.body:
For the first time, poweroff corruption to boot loader of SD card of Orange Pi happened.

Raspberry Pi and Orange Pi are used to be installed with linux OS (Armbian this time) by `dd -if=armbian...img -of=/dev/sd*` command.

I did the above command with the new SD card and did `cp -a /media/oldSDcard/ /;`.

Yes I did this to avoid all those tedious re-installation of the applications and settings of the old SD card Armbian OS. Many things seemed to work fine except nfs server (= remote file sharing server for `mount` on the remote PC).

So I re-did `dd` command above. Voila! I rebooted Orange Pi and `sudo apt update` and `sudo apt upgrade`. Everything came back to the same state with the old SD card!

It means even after `dd` the old one, its original files and settings would be still there. I even didn't need to `dd` the new SD card and copy the old files and settings to the new one.

How can u explain this?

# UPDATE

(2018-12-19 10:08:00+0900)

I found out that the new SD card is used as a boot loader and the old SD card attached via the USB adapter to the Pi is loaded as root partition. I don't know why this happened but at the bootup point, Pi decided to load boot loader from the new SD card and root partition from the old SD card.

So the above hypothesis of mine was false.

post.title: How Firefox addon, MySessions reports users' activity to Google.
post.body:
[https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/my-sessions/?src=search](https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/my-sessions/?src=search)
MySessions :: Show favicons                     
[Privacy Policy](https://addons.mozilla.org/ru/firefox/addon/my-sessions/privacy/)
    Dear friends and users of my add-on, in the process of developing this extension, I spent many hours spent on: adding features, fixing bugs, improving, not to mention supporting all users who asked for help.     In the last few versions of the add-on, I unknowingly violated your privacy. The Google service "http://www.google.com/s2/favicons?domain_url=" was used to display favicons of unloaded sites.         Believe me, I do not work for Google, and did it just because of the lack of information. Everything that I did - I did only for the convenience of users, favicons allow you to better navigate when downloading large sessions.     Now, by default, the display of favicons sites is disabled, the option in the settings is marked in red, as dangerous. ![1.png (0x0)](data/img/post_8_1.png)     Algorithm for getting favicon next, a request is sent "http://www.google.com/s2/favicons?domain_url={Domains_URL_of_a_tab}" only the domain is sent to Google (not the full URL), but this allows Google to collect statistics about the domains you visited.     This extension does not collect cookies, passwords, emails or any other sensitive information. Only domain names (not full URLs) of the websites you visit (if you allow) and nothing else!     Thank you for your support and understanding.
Bug report or suggestions? Go to [email](mailto:balyaev@gmail.com).

post.title: bash command trick: Accepting piped stdout from the previous command without xargs
post.body:
```
echo hello | echo $(cat);
```

\# hello

Amazing!

Before, I used to do as follows

```
echo hello | xargs -i echo {};
```

Or,

```
echo hello | while read a; do echo $a; done;
```
